document.docAuthor: Burks, Roger A., Heraty, John M., Dominguez, Chrysalyn & Mottern, Jason L.
document.docTitle: Orasema carchi Burks & Heraty & Dominguez & Mottern 2018, n. sp.
document.masterDocTitle: Complex diversity in a mainly tropical group of ant parasitoids: Revision of the Orasema stramineipes species group (Hymenoptera: Chalcidoidea: Eucharitidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Complex diversity in a mainly tropical group of ant parasitoids: Revision of the Orasema stramineipes species group (Hymenoptera: Chalcidoidea: Eucharitidae)

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Mesoscutal sidelobe with transverse carinae. Mesoscutellar disc areolate. Axillula areolate. Fore femur with some brown coloration.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 21–26.
Orasema carchi
. ♀: 21. Habitus. 22. Head. 23. Antenna, with F2 and F6–F7 inset. 24. Mesosoma, dorsal view. 25. Axillula. 26. Stigma and postmarginal vein.

subSubSection.paragraph: Color: Head and mesosoma blue green, becoming darker ventrally. Pedicel pale brown; anellus pale brown; flagellum brown. Coxae brown dorsally, becoming yellow apically; fore femur mostly brown, tips pale; mid and hind femora yellow. Fore wing hyaline; venation yellowish brown. Petiole green; gaster brown with purple luster.

Head: Head width:head height 1.0–1.2; face mostly reticulate, becoming smooth ventrally; longitudinal groove between eye and torulus absent; eyes bare, inter-ocular distance:eye height 1.5–1.7; malar space:eye height 0.6–0.8; supraclypeal area longer than broad, smooth ventrally, weakly sculptured dorsally; clypeus smooth.
Flagellum length:head height 1.6–1.8; F2 3.0–3.3× as long as broad, 1.2–1.4× as long as F3; following funiculars progressively shorter and broader.

Mesosoma: Mesosoma length:height 1.2–1.4. Mesoscutal midlobe areolate-reticulate anteriorly, areolate posteriorly, with minute setae; lateral lobe areolate-reticulate to nearly smooth, but always with some transverse carinae. Axilla areolate-reticulate; mesoscutellar disc areolate; frenal line irregularly foveate; frenum areolatereticulate; axillular groove indicated by a strong longitudinal carina; axillula areolate. Propodeum with irregular median carina; propodeal disc areolate; callus areolate-reticulate, with 3–5 setae. Mesepisternum reticulate laterally, becoming areolate-reticulate to smooth ventrally, broadly rounded anterior to mid coxa. Upper mesepimeron smooth to weakly sculptured; lower mesepimeron reticulate to areolate-reticulate; transepimeral sulcus distinct. Metepisternum laterally mostly smooth, weakly sculptured peripherally. Hind coxa 2.1–2.5× as long as broad; hind femur 5.7–7.1× as long as broad. Fore wing 2.7–3.1× as long as broad, 2.6–3.1× as long as mesothorax; stigma with 4 sensilla separated into pairs. Hind wing costal cell with a broad bare area.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 27–30.
Orasema carchi
. ♀: 27. Propodeum. 28. Petiole. ♂: 29. Antenna, with F2 and F6–F7 inset. 30. Petiole.

subSubSection.paragraph: Metasoma: Petiole 2.6–3.2× as long as broad, 1.0–1.1× as long as hind coxa, areolate, anterior carina strong. Antecostal sulcus crossed by carinae; acrosternite posteriorly rounded.

Male. Length 2.4–3.0 mm. Head width:head height 1.1–1.3; scape yellow; flagellum length:head height 1.9– 2.3, F2 2.4–3.3× as long as broad. Fore femur yellow; fore tibia yellow; mid femur yellow; mid tibia yellow; hind femur yellow. hind tibia yellow. Petiole 5.6–7.6× as long as broad, petiole length:hind coxa length 1.6–1.9.

Material examined. Holotype : ECUADOR :
